about_us:
The objectives of employee welfare are to improve the life of the working class, to bring about holistic development of the worker’s personality and so on. Employee welfare is in the interest of employee, employer and the society as a whole. It enables workers to perform their work in healthy and favorable environment.

Hence, it improves efficiency of workers and keeps them content, thereby contributing to high employee morale. It also develops a sense of responsibility and dignity amongst the workers and thus makes them good citizens of the nation.

Apart from the wages and salary, anything done by the organization to improve the living standard of employees and keep them contented comes under the realm of employee welfare. All those services, benefits and facilities offered to employees by the employer to make his life worth living, are included in employee welfare.

According to ILO, “Employee welfare should be understood as such service, facilities and amenities which may be established in or in the vicinity of undertakings to enable the persons employed in them to perform their work in healthy and peaceful surroundings and to avail of facilities which improve their health and bring high morale”.

ADVERTISEMENTS:

Employee welfare is for the betterment of the workers. It involves adjustment of an employee’s work life and family life to the community and social life. Welfare measures may be both voluntary and statutory (prescribed under labour laws).
privacy_policy:
Introduction

This privacy policy applies to the website and online services of [Organization Name]. We respect your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal information. This policy explains how we collect, use, and share your personal information when you visit our website or use our online services.

What Personal Information Do We Collect?

We collect the following types of personal information from you:

  • Contact information: This includes your name, email address, mailing address, and phone number.
  • Payment information: If you make a donation to our organization, we will collect your payment information, such as your credit card number and expiration date.
  • Volunteer information: If you sign up to volunteer for our organization, we will collect your name, email address, and mailing address.
  • Website usage information: We collect information about how you use our website, such as the pages you visit and the links you click.

How Do We Use Your Personal Information?

We use your personal information for the following purposes:

  • To provide you with our products and services. This includes processing your donations, sending you email updates, and providing you with access to our volunteer opportunities.
  • To improve our website and services. We use your website usage information to improve the content and functionality of our website.
  • To send you marketing communications. We may send you email updates about our organization and our work. You can unsubscribe from these emails at any time.
  • To comply with the law. We may use your personal information to comply with applicable laws and regulations.

How Do We Share Your Personal Information?

We may share your personal information with the following third parties:

  • Our payment processor: We use a third-party payment processor to process donations. We will share your payment information with this processor to process your donation.
  • Our website hosting provider: Our website is hosted by a third-party provider. We will share your website usage information with this provider to help us maintain and improve our website.
  • Other third parties: We may share your personal information with other third parties if we are required to do so by law or if we have your consent.

How Do We Protect Your Personal Information?

We take steps to protect your personal information from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, alteration, or destruction. These steps include:

  • Physical security measures: We store our data in secure facilities.
  • Technical security measures: We use encryption and other security measures to protect your data.
  • Access controls: We limit access to your personal information to authorized employees and contractors.

Your Rights

You have the following rights with respect to your personal information:

  • The right to access your personal information: You have the right to request a copy of your personal information that we hold.
  • The right to correct your personal information: If your personal information is incorrect or incomplete, you have the right to request that we correct it.
  • The right to delete your personal information: You have the right to request that we delete your personal information.
  • The right to object to the processing of your personal information: You have the right to object to the processing of your personal information for certain purposes.
  • The right to withdraw your consent: If you have given us consent to process your personal information, you have the right to withdraw your consent at any time.

How to Contact Us

If you have any questions about this privacy policy, please contact us at [email protected]

Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update this privacy policy from time to time. The most recent version of the privacy policy will always be posted on our website.
